intro: Sieruela micrantha subsp. leandrii, commonly known as the leandrii sieruela, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
